    • Constructor Detail

      • ResourceLoader

        public ResourceLoader()

      • ResourceLoader

        public ResourceLoader(java.lang.Class resourcePeerClass,
                      java.lang.String pathRelativeToClassPackage)
        Create a new ResourceLoader and set its resource directory based on the package name of the specified class by converting each dot (.) in the package name to a slash (/). If sub-directory is also specified, it will be appended to the package-derived directory. E.g. ResourceLoader(my.package.MyClass.class, "resources") would set the resource base directory to my/package/resources.
        Parameters:
        resourcePeerClass - The Class from which to obtain the package name.
        pathRelativeToClassPackage - This specifies a sub-directory relative to the package-derived directory from which resources can be obtained. (This can be null or empty, in which case resources will be served directly from the package-derived directory).

      • ResourceLoader

        public ResourceLoader(java.lang.String resourceBaseDir)

      • ResourceLoader

        public ResourceLoader(java.lang.String resourceBaseDir,
                      java.lang.ClassLoader loader)

    • Method Detail

      • addSearchDir

        public void addSearchDir(java.lang.String dir)
        Add a sub-directory (relative to the resource base directory) that will be searched to find requested resources.
        Parameters:
        dir - The subdirectory to add. If the directory starts with a slash (/) it indicates that it is an absolute directory instead of being relative to the resource base directory.

      • addSearchDirs

        public void addSearchDirs(java.lang.String... dirs)
        Add a list of sub-directories (relative to the resource base directory) that will be searched to find requested resources.
        Parameters:
        dirs - A list of subdirectories to add. If a directory starts with a slash (/) it indicates that it is an absolute directory instead of being relative to the resource base directory.

      • getStream

        public java.io.InputStream getStream(java.lang.String resourceName)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Searches for the specified resource in all search directories and returns an an InputStream representing the resource.
        Parameters:
        resourceName - The name of the resource to find.
        Returns:
        An InputStream representing the resource if it is found.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - The specified resource was not found or could not be loaded.

      • getStream

                                     boolean ignoreMissing)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • hasResource

        public boolean hasResource(java.lang.String resourceName)
        Determine whether the specified resource exists.
        Parameters:
        resourceName - The resource to locate.
        Returns:
        True if the resource could be found in one of the search directories or false otherwise.

      • setBaseDir

        public void setBaseDir(@NotNull
                       java.lang.Class<?> resourcePeerClass,
                       java.lang.String pathRelativeToClassPackage)
        Set the resource directory based on the package name of the specified class by converting each dot (.) in the package name to a slash (/). If a non-empty sub-directory is also specified, it will be appended to the package-derived directory. E.g. ResourceLoader(my.package.MyClass.class, "resources") would set the resource base directory to my/package/resources.
        Parameters:
        resourcePeerClass - The Class from which to obtain the package name.
        pathRelativeToClassPackage - This specifies a sub-directory relative to the package-derived directory from which resources can be obtained. (This can be null or empty, in which case resources will be served directly from the package-derived directory).

      • setBaseDir

        public void setBaseDir(java.lang.String pathRelativeToClassPath)

      • setLoader

        public void setLoader(@Nullable
                      java.lang.ClassLoader c)

      • tryGetStream

        public java.io.InputStream tryGetStream(java.lang.String resourceName)
        Searches for the specified resource in all search directories and returns either an InputStream (if the resource is found) or null (if it cannot be found).
        Parameters:
        resourceName - The name of the resource to find.
        Returns:
        An InputStream representing the resource if it is found, or null otherwise.
